Events that occurred on 17 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1923 – J.R.R. Tolkien receives an increase in salary from £600 p.a. to £700 p.a.
1936 – Voice actor David Buck is born.
1952 – J.R.R. Tolkien is appointed supervisor of T.P. Dunning's thesis.
1964 – The second episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
1966 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to schoolchildren in Acocks Green.
1998 – Inkling Colin Hardie dies.
2009 – Mereth Aderthad XV, or "EstelCon", in Carodna, Spain.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
With Frodo severely wounded, Strider and the four hobbits travel slowly towards Rivendell.
Gandalf hurries towards Rivendell after the Black Riders attacked him on Weathertop.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
